server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread
    The Server class, used to represent a server on which a client will connect to register and use a service. I considered the server as a thread itself.
    Author:
    Th√©o Voillemin & Corentin Talarmain

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int pt)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        The constructor of the class. Initialize the attributes, launch the ServerSocket and register on the proxy.
        Parameters:
        pt - the port on which to launch the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method of the thread. In an infinite loop, wait for a notify from a UseThread indicating that a request has been sent and the server can process it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
